;

;北约一名高级军事官员周六警告称，弹药价格大幅上涨意味着盟国更高的国防支出不会自动转化为更大的安全性，并呼吁采取新的防务合作方式。

;

;“装备和弹药的价格正在飙升。现在，我们为完全相同的东西付出越来越多的代价，”荷兰海军上将罗布北约军事委员会主席鲍尔周六在奥斯陆举行的北约国防部长会议后表示。

;

;“这意味着我们无法确保增加的国防开支实际上会带来更多的安全。” “

;

;他推动在国防部门采取新的公私合作方式，以提高产能。

;

;“长期稳定需要压倒短期利润。正如我们在乌克兰看到，战争是全社会的事件。因此，通过韧性和威慑来预防战争也应该是全社会的事件。”

;

;北约一直在迫切要求提高国防生产以满足自俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来对武器装备的猛增需求，因为盟国不仅向基辅紧急供应物资，而且还建立了自己的库存。

;

;一个主要问题是 155 毫米火炮的短缺基辅每天发射多达 10,000 发此类炮弹。

;

;二月份，北约秘书长延斯·斯托尔滕贝格警告基辅;燃烧炮弹的速度;比西方生产炮弹的速度快得多。

;

;此后，北约提高了盟国国家弹药库存的目标

;

;但即使在去年 2 月 24 日俄罗斯入侵乌克兰之前，许多北约国家也未能达到该联盟的库存目标。

;

;从那时起，向乌克兰的交付耗尽了西方库存，并暴露了供应链效率、速度和人力方面的漏洞。

; Sun, 17 Sep 2023 00:55:04 +0800 Iran“s security forces out in force a year after Mahsa Amini“s deathhttps://reuters.com/article/iran-women-father-detained/irans-security-forces-out-in-force-a-year-after-mahsa-aminis-death-idUSKBN30M03B
;;2023-09-16T16:06:41Z;
;;
;;2022 年 12 月 10 日，土耳其伊斯坦布尔，一名妇女参加 Mahsa Amini 去世后反对伊朗伊斯兰政权的抗议活动. REUTERS/Dilara Senkaya;
;

;伊朗安全部队周六短暂拘留了马赫萨·阿米尼 (Mahsa Amini) 的父亲，拘留地点遍及该国主要库尔德地区。一年前，她在警方拘留期间死亡，引发了一些抗议活动。这是自 1979 年国王倒台以来最大规模的抗议活动。

;

;官方媒体报道称，伊朗不同城市逮捕了几名“反革命分子”和“恐怖分子”，并表示安全部队挫败了在各地制造骚乱的阴谋非法示威。

;

;22 岁的库尔德妇女马赫萨·阿米尼 (Mahsa Amini) 在拘留期间死亡，她去年因涉嫌违反强制性着装规范而被道德警察逮捕，引发了数月来最大规模的抗议活动。伊斯兰共和国的什叶派教权统治史无前例，并引起了国际社会的谴责。

;

;周六，也就是她去世一周年之际，据报道，伊朗在库尔德人占多数的地区部署了大规模安全部队，以防发生骚乱。

;

;在阿米尼的家乡伊朗西北部的萨盖兹，半官方的法尔斯通讯社报道说，警察使用子弹枪射击，严重伤害了一名“无视警方警告”的男子。据称，该男子在接受手术后正在重症监护室接受治疗，但没有提供更多细节。

;

;社交媒体上的视频显示，在首都西部卡拉吉市戈哈达什特 (Gohardasht) 社区等地区发生了明显的抗议活动德黑兰和东北部城市马什哈德。

;

;社交媒体上发布的一段视频显示，戈哈达什特的一群示威者高呼“我们是一个伟大的国家，将夺回伊朗”，而司机则按喇叭，大声鼓励。路透社无法立即验证该视频的真实性。

;

;库尔德斯坦人权网络称，马赫萨的父亲阿姆贾德·阿米尼 (Amjad Amini) 在被释放前被警告不要纪念女儿的忌日。伊朗官方伊斯兰通讯社否认阿姆贾德·阿米尼被捕，但没有透露他是否被短暂拘留或警告。

;

;此前，社交媒体和人权组织的报道称，安全部队在阿米尼周围占据了阵地。美国总统乔·拜登在周五的一份声明中表示：“玛赫萨的故事并没有以她的残酷死亡而结束。她激发了一场历史性的运动——女性、生命、自由——这影响了伊朗并影响了全球人民。”

;

;英国周五对四名伊朗官员实施制裁，美国表示正在制裁与伊朗“暴力镇压”有关的两打个人和实体

;

;根据社交媒体帖子，阿米尼的父母在本周早些时候的一份声明中表示，尽管政府发出警告，他们仍将在 22 岁的孩子身上举行“传统和宗教周年纪念仪式”

;

;据报道，伊朗库尔德斯坦地区的多个城市发生了大范围的罢工。

;

;但是，IRNA 表示，阿米尼的家乡萨奇兹“完全安静”，并呼吁在伊朗库尔德斯坦地区举行罢工。由于“人们的警惕以及安全和军事力量的存在”，库尔德地区的失败。

;

;它援引库尔德斯坦省的一名官员的话说：“一些与反革命团体有关联的特工，他们计划制造混乱并准备媒体素材的人于今天凌晨被捕。”

;

;在阿米尼死后的抗议活动中，包括 71 名未成年人在内的 500 多人被杀，数百人受伤，数千人被捕，人权组织表示。伊朗执行了七起与骚乱有关的处决。

;

;国际特赦组织在上个月的一份报告中表示，伊朗当局“一直任意逮捕和拘留受害者家属，对墓地的和平集会施加残酷的限制” ，并摧毁受害者的墓碑”。

;

;许多记者、律师、活动人士、学生、学者、艺术家、公众人物和少数族裔成员被指控与抗议浪潮有联系，以及被杀的抗议者亲属据伊朗和西方人权组织称，在过去几周的骚乱中，阿米尼的家人被逮捕、传唤、威胁或解雇。

;

;伊朗《Etemad日报》8月报道称，阿米尼家人的律师还面临“反体制宣传”的指控。如果罪名成立，萨利赫·尼克巴赫特将面临一年到三年的监禁。

; Sun, 17 Sep 2023 00:25:03 +0800 Texas Senate ends deliberations in AG Paxton“s impeachment trial; Vote imminenthttps://reuters.com/article/texas-politics-impeachment/texas-senate-ends-deliberations-in-ag-paxtons-impeachment-trial-vote-imminent-idUSKBN30M08M
;;2023-09-16T15:29:47Z;

;;美国最高法院听取了总统乔·拜登废除特朗普法案的口头辩论后，德克萨斯州总检察长肯·帕克斯顿在新闻发布会上发表讲话-时代移民政策迫使移民留在墨西哥等待美国对其庇护申请的听证会，美国华盛顿，2022 年 4 月 26 日。REUTERS/Elizabeth Frantz/档案照片;
;

;德克萨斯州参议院参议院主席表示，已结束对司法部长肯帕克斯顿的弹劾审判的审议，并将于周六上午开始对每项腐败指控进行投票。

;

;投票将于中部时间上午 10:30 开始根据副州长丹·帕特里克 (Dan Patrick) 办公室发送的一封电子邮件，他在担任参议院议长期间，以法官身份主持了此次审判。

;

;帕克斯顿 (Paxton)，共和党人，美国前总统唐纳德·特朗普 (Donald Trump) 的盟友自 2014 年上任以来，一直受到腐败指控的困扰。他表示自己是无辜的，弹劾审判是一场政治迫害。

;

;帕克斯顿在参议院审判中面临 16 项弹劾条款。得克萨斯州 31 名参议员中的三分之二（即 21 名参议员）必须就任何一篇文章投票对他定罪。

;

;如果他们这样做，帕克斯顿将被永久解除司法部长职务。然后，参议员将举行另一次投票，以确定他是否被终身禁止在德克萨斯州担任任何全州范围内的民选职位。

;

;帕克斯顿被几名前高级助手指控腐败和滥用权力，主要与官方有关。据称，这些行动是为了保护一名正在接受联邦调查的富有的政治捐助者并掩盖婚外情。

;

;该审判暴露了德克萨斯州共和党内占据主导地位的社会保守派之间的裂痕过去十年来，帕克斯顿和传统保守派人士表示，帕克斯顿的行为给党和国家带来了耻辱。帕克斯顿被共和党主导的德克萨斯州;压倒性弹劾; 5 月众议院选举。

;

;帕克斯顿面临单独的州证券欺诈审判，并正在接受联邦调查局 (FBI) 的调查，自 2014 年首次选举以来，他一直受到腐败指控的困扰。尽管如此，他还是轻松击败了传统保守派候选人乔治·P·布什 (George P. Bush) 在初选，然后是民主党人罗谢尔·加尔萨 (Rochelle Garza) 在 11 月的连任竞选中。

;

;帕克斯顿的弹劾审判于 9 月 5 日开始，一系列前高级助手就他们的指控作了详细的证词。指控他的腐败行为，包括在面临联邦调查时采取法律手段和利用办公室的权力来保护内特·保罗（Nate Paul），一位富有的政治捐助者和房地产开发商。

;

;作为回报，据称保罗帮助促成帕克斯顿的婚外情并支付了房屋装修费用。

;

;帕克斯顿的主要辩护律师托尼·布兹比（Tony Buzbee）试图将出庭作证的举报人描绘成怀有政治斧头的中间派。

;

;德克萨斯州参议院有 19 名共和党人和 12 名民主党人。帕克斯顿的妻子安吉拉是一名共和党参议员，但被禁止在审判中投票。德克萨斯州对全州公职人员的最后一次弹劾审判是在 1917 年。

;

;帕克斯顿的弹劾起因是他要求众议院议员批准他与指控他滥用职权的前工作人员达成的 330 万美元和解协议。随后被解雇。州立法者没有为和解提供资金。

;

;5月，同样由共和党主导的得克萨斯州众议院以121比23投票，就包括围绕保罗的指控在内的20篇文章弹劾帕克斯顿，对举报人进行了虚假调查参议院规则委员会撤销了涉及帕克斯顿私人商业交易的四项指控，众议院指控这些指控妨碍司法公正和虚假陈述。官方记录。

; Sat, 16 Sep 2023 23:55:04 +0800 Flood-hit Libyan city facing long recovery as search for missing goes onhttps://reuters.com/article/libya-storm/flood-hit-libyan-city-facing-long-recovery-as-search-for-missing-goes-on-idUSKBN30M06J
;;2023-09-16T15:46:00Z;
;<视频控件 src="">;;
;;洪水摧毁了建筑物并将人们卷入大海后，遭受重创的利比亚城市德尔纳的居民和救援人员正在努力应对被冲上岸或瓦砾下腐烂的数千具尸体。奥利维亚·陈 (Olivia Chan) 还有更多。;
;

;利比亚东部德尔纳的居民正在计算洪水摧毁了沿海城市大片地区的损失，周六，失踪人员的搜寻工作已连续第六天进行。更多的尸体被从海里打捞出来。

;

;中央大街曾经是德尔纳经济活动的中心，两旁都是商店，现在基本上已经荒废了，只有风吹过被毁坏的建筑物的声音打破了寂静。很少有人闷闷不乐地坐在路边，喝着咖啡，检查受损情况。

;

;“我首先担心的是这需要很长时间，”44 岁的教师塔里克·法希姆 (Tarek Faheem) 说哈萨迪的妻子和五个年幼的孙子在洪水中丧生。他和儿子爬上屋顶才得以幸存。

;

;“这需要坚持，恐怕到来的支持只是暂时的”，他站在被毁坏的家门前，泪流满面地说，但他补充说，他决心不会离开该地区。

;

;哈萨迪说，对面的一栋三层建筑已被洪水冲垮了 60 米（200 英尺）。

;< p>;在德尔纳的海滨，可以看到一辆失事的汽车停在混凝土防风浪板上，浮木散落在泥泞的水池中，挖掘机正在努力为救援队清理道路，一架直升机正在海上扫描寻找尸体。

;

;;德尔纳;整个地区周日晚上，该市以南的两座大坝决堤，洪水倾泻而下，冲入通常干涸的河床，估计至少有 12 万人口被冲走或埋在棕色泥土中。

;

;国际移民组织在利比亚表示，估计已有 5,000 多人死亡，其中医院登记死亡人数为 3,922 人。大约有 38,640 人在洪水灾区流离失所。

;

;官方称，真正的死亡人数可能要高得多。

;

;“情况非常非常悲惨，”盖斯说，一名来自突尼斯海滨的救援人员只透露了自己的名字。 “我们从未见过水造成的如此严重的破坏。”官员卡迈勒·阿尔西维 (Kamal Al-Siwi) 表示，过去三天，我们从海边打捞出了 450 多具尸体，其中 10 具是从废墟下找到的。负责失踪人员。

;

;“这项工作正在进行中，而且非常、非常、非常复杂，”他告诉路透社。 “我认为这项行动需要数月甚至数年的时间。”

;

;世界卫生组织周六表示，已向利比亚东部地区近 25 万名受丹尼尔风暴影响的民众提供了足够的紧急援助物资，其中包括基本药物、为死者提供的手术用品和裹尸袋。

;

;沙特阿拉伯宣布飞往利比亚的第一架援助飞机起飞，俄罗斯表示其第三架援助飞机已经抵达，载有一家流动医院。

;< p>;意大利驻利比亚大使馆称，一艘意大利海军舰艇停靠在德尔纳，船上载有帐篷、毯子、水泵和拖拉机等物资，并张贴了小型船只将设备运上岸的照片。

;

;超过 1,000 人被埋葬据联合国称，援助团体警告称，存在污染水源或给死者家属造成精神困扰的风险。

;

;利比亚国家疾病控制中心主任海德尔·阿尔 (Hayder Al) -Sayah 表示，除非携带疾病，否则尸体带来的风险很小，但由于人们饮用受污染的水，记录的腹泻病例已从周五的 55 例上升到 150 例。

;

;Derna 受到了严重打击自 2011 年北约支持的民众起义推翻穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲以来，利比亚一直处于动荡和冲突之中。

;

;在忠于东部指挥官哈利法·哈夫塔尔的利比亚国民军之前，利比亚一直被圣战武装分子控制了数年军队 (LNA) 于 2019 年围困并控制了该城市。

;

;由于过去十年的政治瘫痪，利比亚各地的基础设施已经退化，;专家警告;，如果不对城外的水坝进行维护工作，德尔纳将面临潜在的灾难.

;

;利比亚持续的政治分歧，以及东部和西部的政府和议会对立，可能会阻碍援助工作。

; Sat, 16 Sep 2023 23:55:04 +0800 EU chief to visit Italy“s Lampedusa amid protests over migrant numbershttps://reuters.com/article/europe-migrants-italy/eu-chief-to-visit-italys-lampedusa-amid-protests-over-migrant-numbers-idUSKBN30M032
;;2023-09-16T15:36:33Z;
;

;一位官员表示，欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉·冯德莱恩将于周日前往兰佩杜萨岛，因为意大利岛上的数十名公民对近期移民人数激增进行抗议。

;

;意大利总理乔治亚·梅洛尼;周五;呼吁欧盟 (EU)“在必要时与海军特派团”联合采取行动，防止来自北非的移民穿越地中海。

;

;近 126,000 名移民今年到目前为止，抵达意大利的人数几乎是 2022 年同一日期的两倍。兰佩杜萨岛最近首当其冲，本周有数千人登陆，超过了该岛的常住人口。

;

;“冯总统德莱恩将于明天应意大利总理梅洛尼的邀请前往兰佩杜萨，”欧盟委员会发言人埃里克·马默在 X（前身为 Twitter）上发帖称。

;

;

;布特莱齐是种族隔离解放斗争中的一个有争议的人物，因为他与非洲人国民大会 (ANC) 激烈竞争，;上周去世;，享年 95 岁。

;Inkatha 自由党 (IFP) 创始人担任两届任期在与执政的非国大对手纳尔逊·曼德拉和解后，担任后种族隔离政府的内政部长。

;

;当布特莱齐决定和解时，已有 20,000 人被杀，数十万人逃离家园他的支持者与非洲人国民大会的支持者之间发生争斗，批评者因此将祖鲁王子称为军阀。

;

;Buthelezi 于 1975 年创立了 IFP，并成为现在夸祖鲁-纳塔尔省的主导力量。与非国大一样，布特莱齐也批评白人少数统治，这种统治将祖鲁人和其他南非黑人国家降级为缩小规模的“家园”。

;

;但他的祖鲁民族主义运动卷入了与非国大的流血冲突中。 20 世纪 80 年代和 90 年代。非国大由敌对的科萨族成员主导，其领导人认为布特莱齐断断续续地愿意与种族隔离当局合作是对所有南非黑人的背叛。

;

;布特莱齐后两党达成了和平。决定参加南非 1994 年的选举，这是自白人少数统治结束、曼德拉上台以来的首次全国大选。

;夸祖鲁-纳塔尔省成为前总统雅各布·祖马（Jacob Zuma）的大本营，雅各布·祖马是拉马福萨的祖鲁人非国大派系在几起腐败丑闻后被驱逐。祖马否认有任何不当行为。

;

;The Lee storm system weakened into a post-tropical cyclone as it closed in on New England and Atlantic Canada on Saturday, producing hurricane-force winds that knocked out power to more than 100,000 people.

;

;The US National Hurricane Center (NHC) said in its latest advisory that Lee would make landfall on Saturday and was about 185 miles (365 km) south-southwest of Halifax Nova Scotia, with maximum sustained winds of 80 mph (130 km/h).

;

;Strong winds, coastal flooding and heavy rains were already occurring in parts of New England and Atlantic Canada, it added.

;

;In the Canadian province of Nova Scotia, more than 100,000 people were without power early on Saturday after high winds brought down trees. In neighboring New Brunswick, 36,000 people had no electricity.

;

;"Crews have been able to restore power to some customers ... however, conditions are getting worse. In many cases, especially when winds are above 80 km/h, it isn't safe for our crews," said Matt Drover of the Nova Scotia electric utility.

;

;Winds have reached over 100 km/h in parts of the west and over 90 km/h in downtown Halifax, the largest city in the province, he said in a statement. Halifax airport was closed to all flights.

;

;Earlier, the Canadian Hurricane Center projected Lee would make landfall in Nova Scotia some time after 3 pm ADT (1800 GMT) or later in New Brunswick with winds below hurricane force.

;

;The potential path could take the storm into the Bay of Fundy, which separates the two provinces and has one of the ;highest tides in the world;, with the difference between high and low tide as much as 12 meters (39 feet), or 16 meters at the head of the bay. Bands from the storm could still be over the bay during a high tide early Sunday morning.

;

;Lee is also expected to generate rainfall of 2-5 inches (5 cm to 12.5 cm).

;

;In anticipation, the administration of US President Joe Biden issued an emergency declaration for Maine and Massachusetts, providing federal assistance for the state ahead of the storm.

;

;"We encourage all of those in the path of this large and dangerous storm to remain alert," White Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told a press briefing.

;

;Lee has been churning as a large hurricane over the Atlantic for more than a week, briefly threatening Bermuda but mostly harmless for anyone on land. It marks the second year in a row that such a powerful storm has reached Canada after Hurricane Fiona ripped into eastern Canada a year ago.

;;
;;Leader of North Korea Kim Jong Un arrived to the Russian city of Vladivostok on Saturday (September 16) morning after getting off the train at the nearby city of Artyom.;
;

;North Korean leader Kim Jong Un inspected Russian nuclear-capable strategic bombers, hypersonic missiles and warships on Saturday, accompanied by President Vladimir Putin's defence minister.

;

;A smiling Kim was greeted in Russia's Knevichi airfield, about 50 km (30 miles) from the Pacific port city of Vladivostok, by Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu, who saluted him. The North Korean leader then inspected a guard of honour.

;

;The United States and South Korea fear the revival of Moscow's friendship with Pyongyang could give Kim access to some of Russia's sensitive missile and other technology while helping arm Russia in its war in Ukraine.

;

;Shoigu showed Kim Russia's strategic bombers - the Tu-160, Tu-95 and Tu-22M3 - which are capable of carrying nuclear weapons and form the backbone of Russia's nuclear air attack force, Russia's defence ministry said.

;

;"It can fly from Moscow to Japan and then back again," Shoigu told Kim of one aircraft.

;

;Kim was shown asking about how the missiles were fired from the aircraft, at times nodding and smiling.

;

;Shoigu showed him the MiG-31I supersonic interceptor aircraft equipped with "Kinzhal" hypersonic missiles. The Kinzhal, or dagger, is an air-launched ballistic missile capable of carrying nuclear or conventional warheads.

;

;It has a reported range of 1,500 to 2,000 km (930-1,240 miles) while carrying a payload of 480 kg (1,100 pounds). It may travel at up to 10 times the speed of sound (12,000 kph, 7,700 mph).

;

;Russia's ambassador to North Korea, Alexander Matsegora, told reporters that Kim's programme was "very intense" and that it was not yet clear how long he would remain in Russia, state news agency RIA reported.

;

;It also quoted Oleg Kozhemyako, governor of Vladivostok's Primorye region, as saying he would have talks with Kim on Sunday on cooperation in sport, tourism and culture.

;

;After the aircraft and missiles, Kim inspected the Russian Pacific Fleet's frigate "Marshal Shaposhnikov" in Vladivostok and saw a demonstration of modern missile control systems, RIA said.

;

;South Korea and the United States said on Friday that military cooperation between North Korea and Russia would violate UN sanctions against Pyongyang and that the allies would ensure there was a price to pay.

;

;Russia has gone out of its way to publicise Kim's visit and drop repeated hints about the prospect of military cooperation with North Korea, which was formed in 1948 with the backing of the Soviet Union.

;

;For Putin, who says Moscow is locked in an existential battle with the West over Ukraine, courting Kim allows him to needle Washington and its Asian allies while potentially securing a deep supply of artillery for the Ukraine war.

;

;Washington has accused North Korea of providing arms to Russia, which has the world's biggest store of nuclear warheads, but it is unclear whether any deliveries have been made.

;

;Kim on Friday ;inspected; a Russian fighter jet factory that is under Western sanctions.

;

;He and Putin discussed military matters, the war in Ukraine and deepening cooperation when they met on Wednesday. Putin told reporters Russia was "not going to violate anything", but would keep developing relations with North Korea.

;

;Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters there had not been a plan to sign any formal agreements during the visit.

;

;Russian diplomats said Washington had no right to lecture Moscow after the United States had bolstered its allies across the world, including with a visit of a US nuclear-armed ballistic missile submarine to South Korea in July.

;

;While in Vladivostok, Kim watched the first act of the ballet "Sleeping Beauty", staged by St Petersburg's Mariinsky theatre, the RIA news agency reported.

;Iranian security forces briefly detained the father of Mahsa Amini on Saturday and spread across mainly Kurdish areas of the country, a year after her death in police custody set off some of the biggest protests since the fall of the Shah in 1979.

;

;State-affiliated media reported arrests of several "counter revolutionaries" and "terrorists" in different Iranian cities and said security forces had foiled plots to create disturbances around illegal demonstrations.

;

;The death in custody of Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old Kurdish woman arrested by the morality police last year for allegedly flouting mandatory dress codes, triggered months of some of the biggest protests against the Islamic Republic's Shi'ite clerical rule ever seen and drew international condemnation.

;

;On Saturday, the first anniversary of her death, a massive security force presence was deployed in Iran's mostly Kurdish areas on Saturday in anticipation of unrest, according to human rights groups.

;

;But footage on social media showed apparent protests in areas including Gohardasht, a neighbourhood of the city of Karaj west of the capital Tehran, and in the northeastern city of Mashhad.

;

;One video posted on social media showed a group of demonstrators in Gohardasht chanting "We are a great nation, and will take back Iran" while drivers honked their horns and shouted encouragement. Reuters could not immediately authenticate the video.

;

;Mahsa's father, Amjad Amini, was warned against marking the anniversary of his daughter's death before being released, the Kurdistan Human Rights Network said. Iran's official IRNA news agency denied that Amjad Amini was arrested, but it did not say if he was briefly detained or warned.

;

;Earlier, social media and reports by rights groups spoke of security forces taking up positions around Amini's home in Saqez, in western Iran.

;

;In a statement on Friday, US President Joe Biden said: "Mahsa's story did not end with her brutal death. She inspired a historic movement — Woman, Life, Freedom — that has impacted Iran and influenced people across the globe."

;

;Britain on Friday imposed sanctions on four Iranian officials and the United States said it was sanctioning more than two dozen individuals and entities connected to Iran's "violent suppression" of protests.

;

;According to social media posts, Amini's parents had said in a statement earlier this week that, despite government warnings, they would hold a "traditional and religious anniversary ceremony" at their 22-year-old daughter's grave in Saqez.

;

;Widespread strikes were reported in multiple cities in Iran's Kurdistan region.

;

;However, IRNA said Amini's hometown of Saqez was "completely quiet" and that calls for strike in Kurdish areas had failed due to "people's vigilance and the presence of security and military forces".

;

;It quoted an official in the Kurdistan province as saying: "A number of agents affiliated with counter-revolutionary groups who had planned to create chaos and prepare media fodder were arrested in the early hours of this morning."

;

;In the protests that followed Amini's death more than 500 people, including 71 minors, were killed, hundreds injured and thousands arrested, rights groups said. Iran carried out seven executions linked to the unrest.

;

;In a report last month, Amnesty International said Iranian authorities "have been subjecting victims' families to arbitrary arrest and detention, imposing cruel restrictions on peaceful gatherings at grave sites, and destroying victims' gravestones".

;

;Many journalists, lawyers, activists, students, academics, artists, public figures and members of ethnic minorities accused of links with the protest wave, as well as relatives of protesters killed in the unrest, have been arrested, summoned, threatened or fired from jobs in the past few weeks, according to Iranian and Western human rights groups.

;

;Iran's Etemad daily reported in August that the lawyer for Amini's family also faced charges of "propaganda against the system". If convicted, Saleh Nikbakht faces a jail sentence of between one and three years.
